subject: AI & Agents
title: Racial Bias in Facial Recognition
description: A micro-lesson that makes Racial Bias in Facial Recognition usable.

hook.text: A study found facial recognition misidentified Black women 35% of the time. For white men? Under 1%.

buildup.text: Training datasets overrepresented lighter-skinned faces, skewing the model's accuracy.

discovery.text: Joy Buolamwini's Gender Shades study exposed this gap and sparked global awareness.

twist.text: Police departments deployed these systems anyway. Innocent people were arrested.

climax.text: Several cities have banned facial recognition by police. Others expanded its use.

punchline.text: If the training data doesn't see you, the AI doesn't see you.

quiz.question: What caused facial recognition to perform worse on darker skin?
options: The cameras couldn't detect darker skin
Darker skin has fewer distinguishing features
